question.title: How to serialize/deserialize JMH result to compare baseline with feature code
question.body:
My requirement: I want to execute JMH tests that will benchmark the performance of my code baseline, save the results in a file and upload to a server. When the same test is executed from a feature branch on the CI, this file will be read and current result will be compared to the result of baseline, and fail if it is longer than a predefined threshold.

Is there a way/class to serialise the result of a JMH test result, that can be deserialized easily ? I know I can output multiple formats, but I did not find any Utility class that allows me to deserialize/parse those formats directly.

Note: I know I can just get a specific number of the result object and persist only that as a double object, but I want the whole result that contains multiple different statistics so I can play with them and do a more complete comparison. That is why I am looking for a way to persist the whole result object.

Any help is appreciated, and thanks in advance !

I have already checked this question, the logic is the same but there is no answer for the implementation details.

question_comments.body: ok. I have edited my question and removed the "best way" expression.

First of all: If you are asking for the best way, it's very likely an opinion-based question which is considered off-topic on Stack Overflow. Please specify what exactly you want to do/what problem you want to solve. Note: We can't tell you what the best way for you is but we might be able to tell you one way to do something.
I didn't edit the question. The first paragraph of my question is my requirement. Please tell me what it is not clear, so I can edit and be more precise.
I don't see any edit to your question. That being said, your comment still sounds like you are looking for opinions on the "best" way.

I have precised my requirement in the question.  I am asking for the best output that can be read in java easily, cause I need to compare the old result read from file with the current test result. I do not want to write the current result in a file, I want to compare directly in code using the result objects.

The "best" way sounds like asking for opinions and depends on your exact requirements- but I guess the easiest to get started with might be CSV (-rf csv) which you can open and merge in a program like LibreOffice Calc or MS Excel and merge there (or just concatenate the files).
